definitions.definition: a product or service that is brought into one country from another

examples.text: cheap imports into the United States
America has cut its oil imports from the Middle East by 73%.
Imports were valued at £516 million last month.
Special duties were imposed on imports into the republic.
The value of annual imports rose rapidly.

definitions.definition: the act of bringing a product or service into one country from another

examples.text: The report calls for a ban on the import of hazardous waste.
A restricted import quota was set for meat products.
the UK's net imports of food
Most of their oil revenues are used to finance imports of consumer and capital goods.

definitions.definition: the meaning of something, especially when it is not immediately clear

examples.text: It is difficult to understand the full import of this statement.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘signify’): from Latin importare ‘bring in’ (in medieval Latin ‘imply, mean, be of consequence’), from in- ‘in’ + portare ‘carry’.
